channel.title: Workspace 101: Working Folder Mappings
channel.description: So in my previous post, I introduced the concept of a TFS workspace. If you only have one TFS workspace then you might have so far been blissfully unaware that you had one. This is because one is created...
channel.dc:creator: Martin

item.title: Comment by Seyed+00:00
item.description: Thanks for this, It saved me a lot. actually I was wondering how to change my local copy of sorce control.
item.dc:creator: Seyed

item.title: Comment by jay+00:00
item.description:
Martin-
Your post mentions a followup that I hoped would answer this question.
Lets say I have a workspace where I have all my code that I'm actively working on. If I also want another workspace on the same machine where I can get a specific version of all the code, say to do a build, is this possible? I've setup another workspace, pointed it to a different local folder, but anything I try using tf.exe get results in a "the path XXX is already mapped in workspace YYY". XXX and YYY always refer to the "working" workspace, not the one I want to do my build from.
item.dc:creator: jay

item.title: Comment by Anonymous+00:00
item.description: Why can't I have two workspaces defined as: c:\projects\sustainedEng and c:\projects\probation where one points to sustainedEng on the tfs server and the other to probation on the tfs server? If I define my workspaces as: c:\sustainedEng and c:\probation it works (!@#@$%$#^#) Why can't they be under my 'projects' directory?
item.dc:creator: Anonymous

item.title: Comment by kishore+00:00
item.description:
you are man of my day.. i was using eclipse and visual studio in parallel and trying to setup teamprise plug in for eclipse. And with team workspace i can't able to import project into eclipse since a project from repository is already tied to local directory as default workspace in visual studio.
I'm writing the fix i found for my issue here in case if anyone runs into it can easily get away with it. I deleted all the tfs workspaces from VS 2008 and started a fresh, first i imported project from TFS repository into eclipse and it was succefull since theres no workspace mapping conflict as i started a fresh. And to make sure things i renamed the default workspace file created for TFS to xxxxECLIPSE and then i opened my visual studio and then configured another ws with the default name and pointed to same tfs repository . since its new workspace it worked like a charm. thanks martin for explaing the TFS workspace inherent details. that helped in resolving my issue of setting up same repository in visual studio and eclipse as well.
item.dc:creator: kishore

item.title: Comment by Tomy+00:00
item.description:

could you also explain about the working direcotry under build agent properties window and it's relation to the local path specified in the workspace.
item.dc:creator: Tomy

item.title: Comment by Arun+00:00
item.description:
"cannot have two repository paths mapped to one local path on the same computer."
How to remove the mapping?
i need to map to same folder which was used by other person; he is nolonger going to use that folder.
item.dc:creator: Arun

item.title: Comment by senthil+00:00
item.description:
Case 1:
1. we have 2 branch of code in TFS a. branch1 b. branch2 2. we have virtual directories mapped to WS folders.
Can we have 2 workspace mapping to same local folder , mapping to diffrent branch so i dont have remap all my virtual directories.
thanks in advance
senthil
item.dc:creator: senthil
